Description: Although autoantibodies are commonly associated with autoimmune disease, there is growing evidence of their utility in understanding the progression of cancer and patient response to therapeutic treatment.  Aberrant gene expression and mutations in tumors can result in a unique set of neoantigens that can become immunogenic.  Because the humoral immune system is constantly surveilling and marking out disease-associated changes, autoantibodies serve as biomarkers that directly reflect the disease state. Sengenics has developed a platform for specifically and reproducibly profiling autoantibodies.  We will share data demonstrating the utility of autoantibody signatures in predicting treatment response and guiding treatment decision-making.
SearchResultBody: ESP03. Sengenics: Autoantibody Biomarkers – Response Prediction in Immuno-Oncology
Title: Sengenics: Autoantibody Biomarkers – Response Prediction in Immuno-Oncology
